primer.title: How AI Agents Work
primer.subtitle: Learn the 4+2 model before you build

intro.heading: The 4+2 Model
intro.description: Every agent follows a 4-step run loop, supported by 2 cross-cutting systems

perception.label: 1. Read the Data
perception.description: Transform raw inputs into structured information

reasoning.label: 2. Decide What It Means
reasoning.description: Analyze the data and determine what to do

planning.label: 3. Make a Plan
planning.description: Choose the specific action to take next

memory.label: Memory (Learning)
memory.description: Stores knowledge and contextâ€”any step can read or write to it

tools.label: Tools & UI (Interaction)
tools.description: How the agent acts in the worldâ€”any step can call tools or show output

crossCutting.title: Why "Supporting Systems"?
crossCutting.description: Memory and Tools aren't steps in the loopâ€”they're resources available to ALL four steps

demo.title: See It In Action
demo.subtitle: Watch the 4+2 model handle a health coaching scenario

perception.label: Read the Data (Perception)
perception.example: Agent receives heart rate readings: [72, 68, 75, 71 BPM] and step count: 8,500 steps

reasoning.label: Decide What It Means (Reasoning)
reasoning.example: Agent checks if heart rate is within healthy range (60-100 BPM) and step count meets goal (â‰¥7,000 steps)

planning.label: Make a Plan (Planning)
planning.example: Agent decides to send an encouragement notification since metrics are healthy

execution.label: Take Action (Execution)
execution.example: Agent calls sendNotification tool: "Great job! Your heart rate is steady and you hit your step goal."

memory.label: ðŸ§  Memory Used Throughout
memory.example: Agent stores user's baseline metrics and retrieves historical patterns to inform reasoning

tools.label: ðŸ”§ Tools Called When Needed
tools.example: Agent uses sendNotification tool in Execution step to deliver the message

check1.question: Which step chooses the specific action to take next?
check1.explanation: Planning is where the agent decides WHICH action to take. Reasoning figures out what the situation means; Planning chooses the response.

check2.question: Where does "Send a notification to the user" belong?
check2.explanation: Sending notifications uses the Interaction system (Tools & UI). This is a supporting system available throughout the loopâ€”usually called during the Execution step.

complete.title: You've Got the 4+2 Model!
complete.description: Now you're ready to practice applying it

remember.title: Remember:
remember.point1: 4-step loop: Read â†’ Decide â†’ Plan â†’ Do
remember.point2: Memory and Tools support all steps (not in the loop)
remember.point3: Understanding WHY something belongs where matters more than just getting it right

workedExample.title: Watch an Expert Think
workedExample.subtitle: See how an expert classifies agent capabilities and why
workedExample.mightThink: You might think this belongs in

tip.title: Learning Tip
tip.description: Notice the expert focuses on WHAT the capability DOES, not just its name. Ask: Does it transform inputs? Make decisions? Choose actions? Execute steps?

parseSensor.explanation: This transforms raw input (sensor readings) into structured information the agent can work with. That's the core job of Perception.

thresholdCheck.text: Check if heart rate is within healthy range
thresholdCheck.explanation: This analyzes the data to determine what it means (is it healthy or concerning?). That's Reasoningâ€”deciding what the situation calls for.

chooseAction.text: Decide whether to encourage or alert the user
chooseAction.explanation: This chooses which specific action to take next based on reasoning. That's Planningâ€”selecting the response strategy.

sendMessage.explanation: This carries out the chosen action, executing the plan. Execution is where the agent acts on its decisions.

storeBaseline.text: Remember user's baseline heart rate for future comparisons
storeBaseline.explanation: This stores knowledge for later use. Memory (Learning) is a supporting systemâ€”not a step in the loop, but available throughout.

callApi.text: Fetch user's calendar to avoid alerts during meetings
callApi.explanation: This uses external tools or APIs to interact with the world. Tools/UI (Interaction) is a supporting system available to any step.

calendarNearMiss.text: Schedule a follow-up check for tomorrow
calendarNearMiss.explanation: Scheduling uses the calendar API (a tool), making this Interaction. Near-miss: it feels like Planning because it's about 'planning ahead,' but the ACT of scheduling is tool use.
calendarNearMiss.nearMissExplanation: it involves planning ahead in time

model.title: How agents work: a 4-step run loop + 2 supporting systems (4+2)

runLoop.title: 4-Step Run Loop
runLoop.description: Read the data (Perception) â†’ Decide what it means (Reasoning) â†’ Make a plan (Planning) â†’ Do the step (Execution)

memory.title: Memory (Learning)
memory.description: The agent's notesâ€”any stage can read or update them

tools.title: Tools & UI (Interaction)
tools.description: How the agent acts in the worldâ€”any stage can call a tool or show something to a user

model.crossCutting: Cross-cutting: available to any stage rather than a step in the line

home.title: AI Agents Learning Platform
home.subtitle: Master AI agents from core concepts to building your ownâ€”through interactive, pedagogically-designed activities

understand.title: Understand
understand.description: Learn the six core processes that make AI agents work: Learning, Interaction, Perception, Reasoning, Planning, and Execution

practice.title: Practice
practice.description: Map agent boundaries, build circuits, run simulations, and debug failures through hands-on activities

build.title: Build
build.description: Design and construct your own agents, evaluate their performance, and iterate based on real feedback

classification.title: Phase 1: Classification & Explanation
classification.description: Classify agent capabilities into the six core processes and explain your reasoning. Remember the 4+2 model: 4 steps in the run loop, plus 2 supporting systems.
classification.dragInstruction: Drag items to the correct process category and explain your reasoning
classification.explainPlaceholder: Explain why you placed this item here...
classification.explanationRequired: Please provide explanations for all items before submitting
classification.continueDescription: Review your feedback and continue to the next phase
classification.crossCuttingHint: Cross-cutting: available to any stage rather than a step in the line

hints.learning: Supporting system: Stores knowledge and improves over time (not in the 4-step loop)
hints.interaction: Supporting system: Provides tools and communication (not in the 4-step loop)

confidence.title: Confidence Level
confidence.question: How confident are you in your classifications?

feedback.title: Feedback & Results
feedback.calibrationDescription: How well your confidence matched your actual performance

boundaryMap.title: Phase 2: Boundary Mapping
boundaryMap.description: Map the agent's environment, tools, and data flows to understand system boundaries
boundaryMap.selectFirst: Select an element on the canvas first
boundaryMap.clickToConnect: Click a process to connect the selected element

feedback.needMoreElements: Please place at least {{count}} elements on the canvas to continue
feedback.needMoreConnections: Please create at least {{count}} connections to processes to continue
feedback.missingProcesses: Please connect elements to these core processes: {{processes}}
feedback.needSensorToPerception: Connect at least one Sensor element to Perception (sensors provide input data)
feedback.needExecutionToTool: Connect Execution to at least one API, Tool, or UI element (execution needs to interact with the world)
feedback.success: Great work! Your boundary map is complete

circuit.title: Phase 3: Build Your Health Coach Agent
circuit.description: Your agent is already configured with working blocks. Run it to see how it processes wearable data!
circuit.pipelineDescription: Select a block for each process to build your agent
circuit.dragInstruction: Select blocks for each step of the pipeline
circuit.connectInstructions: Connect blocks by dragging from one block's edge to another. Click and drag blocks to reposition them.
circuit.readyToTestDescription: Continue to Phase 4 to run your agent and see it in action

simulation.title: Phase 4: Run & Test Your Agent
simulation.description: Watch your agent process real data, then experiment with different blocks and failure modes
simulation.buildCircuitFirst: Build a circuit to run a simulation

failures.title: Failure Injection
failures.description: Toggle faults to observe how the agent handles errors and edge cases
failures.activeFailures: {{count}} failure(s) active. Run the simulation to observe the effects.

noisyInput.name: Noisy Sensor Data
noisyInput.description: Heart rate readings fluctuate Â±15 BPM, simulating sensor noise or measurement error
noisyInput.tooltip: Adds Â±15 BPM jitter to heart rate readings

reducedActivity.name: Reduced Step Count
reducedActivity.description: Daily steps are reduced by 800, testing threshold logic for borderline activity levels

missingTool.name: Missing Notification Tool
missingTool.description: The sendNotification tool is unavailable, preventing the agent from alerting the user
missingTool.tooltip: Removes the sendNotification tool from available tools

staleMemory.name: Stale Memory State
staleMemory.description: Agent's memory is cleared, losing all context from previous steps

assessment.title: Phase 5: Assessment & Review
assessment.description: Review your performance across all phases and identify areas for growth
assessment.excellentCalibrationDesc: Your confidence levels closely match your actual performance. This indicates strong metacognitive awareness.
assessment.strongClassificationDesc: You've demonstrated solid understanding of the six agent processes.
assessment.improveExplanationsDesc: Try to provide more detailed reasoning that connects the item to the process's core function.

exitCheck.title: Final Understanding Check
exitCheck.description: Answer these questions to confirm your grasp of the 4+2 model

q1.question: Which activity belongs to the run loop vs the rails?

q2.question: Which step in the run loop chooses the action?

q3.question: Where is the habit streak stored?

feedbackLoops.definition: Mechanisms that allow the agent to learn from outcomes and adjust future behavior
feedbackLoops.example: After a failed action, the agent updates its strategy for similar situations

adaptation.definition: The agent's ability to modify its behavior based on new information or changing conditions
adaptation.example: Adjusting recommendations when user preferences change

memory.definition: Storage and retrieval of past interactions, decisions, and learned patterns

welcome.title: Your agent is ready!
welcome.message: The pipeline is already set up with working blocks. Click 'Run Demo' to see the 4-step run loop in action.
welcome.tip: You'll go through the 4-step loop; any step may tap Memory ðŸ§  or Tools ðŸ”§

firstRun.title: Run your first demo
firstRun.message: Your Health Coach agent is configured. Click 'Run Demo' to watch it execute the full 4-step loop.
firstRun.tip: Watch each stage: Read the data â†’ Decide what it means â†’ Make a plan â†’ Do the step. Notice which steps use Memory ðŸ§  or Tools ðŸ”§!

successFirst.title: Success! Your agent worked perfectly
successFirst.message: The agent completed the 4-step loop successfully. Circle where you see ðŸ§ /ðŸ”§ in the trace. Which steps used them?
successFirst.tip: Now try swapping one of the blocks to see how different logic changes the result. Notice how Memory stores data between steps!

changeBlock.title: Try changing something!
changeBlock.message: Experiment by swapping blocks in the pipeline. Each block has different logic that will produce different results.
changeBlock.tip: For example, Rule Classifier uses stricter criteria than Threshold Check. Watch how this changes what gets stored in Memory ðŸ§  and which Tools ðŸ”§ get called!

failureRecovery.title: Simulation failed - Let's debug
failureRecovery.message: The agent encountered an error during the run loop. Check the logs to see which step failed and why.
failureRecovery.tip: Which step chose the action? â†’ Planning. Where was the habit streak stored? â†’ Learning (Memory ðŸ§ ). Understanding this helps debug!

withFailures.title: Observing failure handling
withFailures.message: You've injected failures. Toggle 'Noisy input' and runâ€”does your Perception step change? Why?
withFailures.tip: Notice how failures affect different parts: noisy sensors hit Perception, missing tools hit Execution ðŸ”§, stale data hits Memory ðŸ§ !

tryFailure.title: Great work!
tryFailure.message: You've seen how the 4-step loop handles normal operation. Try toggling failure modes to see how each step responds to errors.
tryFailure.tip: Watch which steps tap into Memory ðŸ§  (Learning) and which call Tools ðŸ”§ (Interaction). These supporting systems work with any step in the loop!

normalDay.name: Normal Active Day
normalDay.description: Healthy activity levels with clean sensor data

borderlineActivity.name: Borderline Activity
borderlineActivity.description: Just below activity thresholdâ€”tests edge cases

parse.name: Parse Wearables
parse.description: Extract raw heart rate and step count from sensor data

smooth.name: Smooth Wearables
smooth.description: Average readings to reduce sensor noise and outliers

threshold.name: Threshold Check
threshold.description: Simple rule: Active if steps â‰¥ 8000 and HR â‰¥ 90

ruleBased.name: Rule Classifier
ruleBased.description: Strict criteria: steps â‰¥ 10000 and HR â‰¥ 100 for active

daily.name: Daily Planner
daily.description: Create today's response: congratulate if active, nudge if not

weekly.name: Weekly Planner
weekly.description: Plan weekly trends and suggest long-term habits

notify.name: Send Notification
notify.description: Deliver push notification with encouragement or nudge

message.excellent: Amazing work! You exceeded your goals!
message.active: Great job hitting your step goal!
message.nudge: You can do it! Just a few more steps to reach your goal.

message.rest: Your heart rate is elevated. Please rest and consult a doctor if this continues.
message.lightActivity: Your heart rate is slightly elevated. Consider light activity only.
message.congratulate: Great job! Your metrics look healthy.
message.encourage: Your health metrics are good - you can safely increase activity!
